programme.title: The Prestige
programme.desc: Suspenseful tale of the rivalry between two Victorian-era magicians and their dangerous obsession with outdoing each other. Their feud eventually centers on a trick in which the men appear to teleport across the stage, but neither one is willing to reveal the secret of how it is accomplished

programme.title: What Planet Are You From?
programme.desc: A highly-evolved planet, whose denizens feel no emotion and reproduce by cloning, plans to take over Earth from the inside

programme.title: Dodgeball: A True Underdog Story
programme.desc: Anarchic comedy that follows the efforts of a hapless gym proprietor and his misfit clients as they attempt to fend off the takeover bid of a rival bodybuilding empire. To generate much-needed cash for the virtually bankrupt facility, the motley crew enter themselves in a national dodgeball tournament and set themselves on course for a bruising showdown with a team made up of their foes. However, while the gym's unmotivated owner initially takes part only to appease his friends, he soon falls in love with the fast-paced sport - and the lawyer sent to oversee his finances!

programme.title: Concussion
programme.desc: Filmmaker Peter Landesman (Parkland) wrote and directed this sports-themed drama based on Jeanne Marie Laskas' GQ article "Game Brain," about the potentially horrific cost of playing football. Pittsburgh-based neuropathologist Dr. Bennet Omalu (Will Smith) discovers a degenerative brain disease now known as CTE in the autopsies of several deceased pro-football players, but after presenting his research, he finds himself under fire from the NFL. Gugu Mbatha-Raw, Luke Wilson, Alec Baldwin, Bitsie Tulloch, and Albert Brooks co-star

programme.title: Broken Horses
programme.desc: A newly engaged man (Anton Yelchin) returns home, and discovers that his brother (Thomas Jane) is deeply involved in the underground dealings of the violent USA-Mexico border wars. Their bonds of loyalty and brotherhood are soon put to the test in this slick thriller from director Vidhu Vinod Chopra

programme.title: Valkyrie
programme.desc: Based on actual events, ¿Valkyrie¿ goes back to the Nazi Germany during WWII as the tide turns in favor of the Allies. A proud military man, Colonel Claus von Stauffenberg (Tom Cruise) desperately plots to topple the Nazi regime before the nation is crushed in a near-inevitable defeat. Realizing that time is running out, he decides that he must take action himself and joins the German resistance. Armed with a cunning strategy to use Hitler's own emergency plan - known as Operation Valkyrie - von Stauffenberg and his men plot to assassinate the dictator and overthrow his Nazi government from the inside

programme.title: Foxcatcher
programme.desc: Docudrama about millionaire John du Pont, who fatally shot Olympic gold-medal wrestler Dave Schultz and proceeded to lock himself in his mansion for two days as the police attempted to negotiate with him

programme.title: The Invisible
programme.desc: A severely beaten teenager, trapped in a walking purgatory between life and death, must help authorities to the location of his broken body before it's too late in this remake of the 2002 Swedish thriller Den Osynlige. Graduating senior Nick Powell (Justin Chatwin) has plans to attend a prestigious writing workshop in London, despite the protests of his widowed mother (Marcia Gay Harden). In the days before his departure, he gets into a cafeteria brawl with a delinquent classmate, Annie Newton (Margarita Levieva), while defending his friend from her extortion attempts. Annie and her crew track Nick down on the night he's planning to leave, mistakenly thinking he ratted her out to the police regarding a smash-and-grab burglary committed the night before. When the subsequent beating goes too far, the assailants dump the body in the woods in a panicked attempt to dispose of it. Only, Nick isn't dead -- he's walking invisible among his classmates, friends, and family, desperately trying to alert them that he's still alive. Robbed of the traditional forms of communication, Nick must figure out supernatural methods of manipulating his environment -- and he soon realizes the very girl who attacked him may be the only one who has the power to save him

programme.title: Irrational Man
programme.desc: In this offbeat comedy from Woody Allen, nothing can snap a cynical philosophy professor out of a mental funk, except for a young student whose presence offers a breath of fresh air in his otherwise unfulfilling existence

programme.title: Spider-Man 3
programme.desc: The superhero battles a space sludge, which causes his suit to turn black and enhances his powers, but also begins to take over his personality. Meanwhile, the man who caused his uncle's death becomes Sandman; and the New Goblin is out to avenge his father's death

programme.title: Freaks of Nature
programme.desc: A town full of humans, zombies, and vampires living in coexistence are thrust into an all-out war when aliens invade in this wild horror comedy. Now, three teens must defeat the newest visitors to restore the peace

programme.title: The Fifth Element
programme.desc: Stunning, audacious science-fiction thriller stars Bruce Willis as an ex-government agent, now reduced to driving a taxi in 23rd century New York. Into his lap falls the mysterious Milla Jovovich, a woman created from an alien cell who may be the only hope the world has of salvation from an ever-approaching evil

programme.title: Rudderless
programme.desc: A father destroyed by the death of his son finds inspiration in the most unexpected of places in the feature directorial debut of veteran actor William H. Macy, who co-authored the screenplay with Casey Twenter and Jeff Robison. In the wake of his son's death, successful advertising executive Sam (Billy Crudup) moves aboard a docked sailboat, and drifts into an alcohol-induced haze. Something deep within Sam begins to stir however, when he discovers his late son's demo tapes, and decides to take a listen. Deeply moved by his son's artistry and determined not to let the boy's dreams die with him, Sam determines to learn each song note-for-note, and later summons the courage to perform one of them publicly. That performance, in turn, prompts aspiring musician Quentin (Anton Yelchin) to approach Sam, and together they form a band that transforms their lives in ways neither ever dreamt possible. Selena Gomez, Felicity Huffman, and Laurence Fishburne co-star

programme.title: Separate Lies
programme.desc: Julian Fellowes, who won an Oscar for his "Gosford Park" screenplay, makes his directorial debut with this incisive and engrossing study of a well-heeled British couple (Tom Wilkinson, Emily Watson) who become embroiled in a murder cover-up. Fellowes also wrote the script which he adapted from Nigel Balchin's 1951 novel "A Way Through The Wood." Rupert Everett, David Harewood, John Neville, Linda Bassett, Hermione Norris, John Warnaby

programme.title: Butterfly
programme.desc: On the verge of the Spanish Civil War, a young boy (Manuel Lozano) learns about life, nature and politics from his kindly old schoolteacher (Fernando Fernán Gómez). Rosa: Uxia Blanco. Ramón: Gonzalo Uriarte. Andres: Alexis de Los Santos. O'Lis: Guillermo Toledo

programme.title: Wristcutters: A Love Story
programme.desc: Relegated to a forlorn afterlife of unsmiling lost souls and melancholy drifters as a result of committing suicide in the mortal realm, a heartbroken young man sets out to find the girl who inspired his final act of self-destruction after learning that she too has taken her own life in director Goran Dukic's adaptation of Etgar Keret's darkly comic novella Kneller's Happy Campers. A likeable young man despite his depressive disposition, Zia (Patrick Fugit) puts blade to wrist only to find that the pain of life doesn't end with the coming of death. Now trapped in a bleak metaphysical landscape populated entirely by suicide victims blearily searching for the joys that eluded them in the physical realm, Zia soon learns that the love is one of the latest arrivals in the dreary land of the dead. As Zia sets out to locate his ill-fated former companion and experience the joys that eluded the couple in life, he is joined in his quest by a lovelorn Russian rocker named Eugene (Shea Wigham) and an accidental tourist named Mikal (Shannyn Sossamon), who's looking for a way out of the sorrowful stir

programme.title: I Heart Huckabees
programme.desc: David O'Russell's existential comedy stars Jason Schwartzman as Albert Markovski, an environmentalist who teams up with the chain store Huckabees to promote his cause. Huckabees representatives Brad Stand and Dawn Campbell just need him as a cover for their expansion plans. But when Albert hires existential detectives Bernard and Vivian Jaffe, their 24/7 surveillance of Albert, Brad and Dawn soon reveals a series of philosophical connections, even though Bernard and Vivian are being followed by rival detective Caterine Vauban. Russell's sheer audacity and the weaving of the various characters' searches for meaning into the plot make for an intriguing, original film

programme.title: Singles
programme.desc: Romantic comedy starring Bridget Fonda and Campbell Scott as two of a group of six young friends who are searching for love in 90's Seattle

programme.title: Infinitely Polar Bear
programme.desc: A man who is bipolar attempts to win back his estranged wife by taking care of their two young, spirited daughters

programme.title: Amistad
programme.desc: Epic historical drama which documents a legal battle over a shipload of slaves who overpowered their captors at sea and landed on the shores of America. Initially, the argument in the courts revolves around the issue of property and ownership. Gradually though, the lawyers for the defence come to understand and appreciate the humanity of the men turned into cargo by the evils of slavery

programme.title: Red Dragon
programme.desc: Notorious cannibal Hannibal Lecter is recruited to advise an FBI agent who's trying to hunt down a serial killer. Thriller

programme.title: Outlander
programme.desc: The Devil's Mark. As Claire and Geillis are put on trial for witchcraft, Jamie is able to rescue Claire, who has unearthed a secret from Geillis' past

programme.title: Outlander
programme.desc: Lallybroch. Claire and Jamie are reunited and head to his family home, where old animosities between Jamie and his sister, Jenny, are rekindled

programme.title: Infinitely Polar Bear
programme.desc: In this comedy-drama set in the 1970s, a bipolar man promises his estranged wife that he will care for their two young daughters while she attends business school in New York

programme.title: I Heart Huckabees
programme.desc: An environmentalist hires existential detectives to make sense of his life while he battles a department store's dubious intentions

programme.title: Amistad
programme.desc: Anthony Hopkins, Morgan Freeman and Djimon Hounsou star in Steven Spielberg's sweeping, vividly portrayed historical drama. Set in 1839, the tale follows African slaves who rebel against their captors before their ship reaches U.S. shores. The film also chronicles their recapture in America and the trial that followed. Matthew McConaughey, Nigel Hawthorne, David Paymer, Pete Postlethwaite, Stellan Skarsgard, Anna Paquin

programme.desc: No additional information is available

programme.title: Bottle Rocket
programme.desc: Delightful comedy from the director of Rushmore, about two friends who get hopelessly mixed up with the crime scene in suburban Dallas. They eventually get involved with a local crime boss, which results in even more misunderstanding and failure for the wannabe hoods

programme.title: The Story of Us
programme.desc: This incisive comedy-drama chronicles the breakdown of the 15-year marriage between a TV-comedy writer and a crossword-puzzle editor, who must decide if they want to salvage their union or move on after the spark goes out of their relationship

programme.title: The Walk
programme.desc: In this moving drama based on a true story, tightrope walker Philippe Petit crosses back and forth between the Twin Towers in 1974. Petit works to accomplish this feat while dealing with logistical problems and the concern of his loved ones

programme.title: Brokedown Palace
programme.desc: Two carefree Americans embark on an overseas vacation that soon becomes a nightmare in this powerful drama. Alice (Claire Danes) is a headstrong teenager who wants to do something different to celebrate her high school graduation, so she persuades her more reserved best friend Darlene (Kate Beckinsale) to join her on a trip to Bangkok. While enjoying sun and scenery, Alice and Darlene meet Nick Parks (Daniel Lapaine), a charming Australian who shows them the sights and sweet-talks Darlene into a romantic assignation, which is something of a surprise to her bolder friend Alice. Nick then suggests that they join him on a side trip to Hong Kong, but they soon discover that Nick's interest has been neither friendly nor romantic: he has hidden a large amount of heroin in their luggage and is using them as drug runners without their knowledge. When the heroin is found by customs officials, Alice and Darlene are quickly tried and sentenced to 33 years in a hideous prison known to inmates as Broke-Down Palace. Their plight comes to the attention of "Yankee Hank" (Bill Pullman), a renegade American attorney in Asia, but while Hank struggles with the court system to get Alice and Darlene released, they must deal with the living hell of life behind bars, and their own doubts about each other. Brokedown Palace was directed by Jonathan Kaplan, who previously dealt with judicial injustice in The Accused and teens in difficult circumstances in Over the Edge

programme.title: Biutiful
programme.desc: Dignified criminal and caring family man Uxbal works to put his affairs in order after being diagnosed with a terminal illness, only to realise that few of the people around him have any sense of personal responsibility

programme.title: Aloft
programme.desc: A mother reunites with her estranged son, whom she abandoned two decades earlier after a strange encounter with a faith healer

programme.title: Man on Wire
programme.desc: Documentary based on Philippe Petit's autobiographical book To Reach the Clouds: My High Wire Walk Between the Twin Towers. In August 1974, French wire-walker Philippe Petit spent nearly an hour walking, dancing, kneeling and lying on a wire which he and his friends had strung in secret between the rooftops of New York's Twin Towers. Six years of intense planning, dreaming and physical training fell into place that morning. Using contemporary interviews, archival footage and dramatic reconstructions, the film tells the story of this extraordinary feat

programme.title: The Walk
programme.desc: In this moving drama based on a true story, tightrope walker Philippe Petit crosses back and forth between the Twin Towers in 1974. Petit works to accomplish this feat while dealing with logistical problems and the concern of his loved ones

programme.title: Outlander
programme.desc: The Watch. Problems arise with the return of a redcoat deserter from Jamie's past, and Jamie and Ian join The Watch, while Claire tends to Jenny

programme.title: Outlander
programme.desc: The Search. Claire and Jenny head off to save Jamie from the redcoat captors and meet up with Murtagh, who joins them. The trio employ unusual tactics to get word to Jamie

programme.title: Rescue Dawn
programme.desc: Drama following a US fighter pilot's epic struggle for survival after being shot down on a mission over Laos during the Vietnam War

programme.title: There's Something About Mary
programme.desc: Slapstick comedy about a man so tormented by memories of a missed date with a beautiful girl that he hires a detective to trace her several years later. He is convinced that he missed out on his only chance for love, but when the detective locates her, he himself is smitten and soon proves to be a ruthless and unscrupulous rival in love

programme.title: Big Fish
programme.desc: Teller of tall tales Edward is dying, so his estranged son Will comes home to make peace. As, yet again, Edward relates fanciful stories of his youth, Will starts to think that there could be some truth in them

programme.title: This Is My Life
programme.desc: Nora Ephron's directorial debut This Is My Life (based on Meg Wolitzer's novel This is Your Life) is about a single working mother (Julie Kavner) whose attention is torn between her two daughters and her promising career as a stand-up comedian

programme.title: Drive Me Crazy
programme.desc: A popular high-school student tries to mold her eccentric next-door neighbor into the perfect prom date in order to make an old flame jealous

programme.title: Kissing a Fool
programme.desc: Friends star David Schwimmer stars in this romantic comedy as Max, a womanising sports reporter who falls in love at first sight with Sam, a woman with whom he has nothing in common. As the couple prepare for their wedding day, Max suffers a crisis of confidence - is this really the woman he will spend the rest of his life with? In a bid to find out, Max concocts a cunning plan to test Sam's love for him. But will it backfire?

programme.title: Sorority Boys
programme.desc: Dave, Adam and Doofer are kicked out of bad boy fraternity KOK for embezzling the party fund. The trio, desperate to prove their innocence, dress in drag to sneak back into the frat and steal the sexy video that will reveal the real thief. Bawdy comedy

programme.title: Be Cool
programme.desc: Mobster Chili Palmer ditches the movie biz for the music industry when he decides to manage a singer in this sequel

programme.title: Blankman
programme.desc: Are you ready for a new kind of superhero -- a thirty-something virgin in long underwear? Darryl Walker (Damon Wayans) is a bright but socially inept man with a gift for inventing things but little skill for functioning in the real world. His brother Kevin (David Alan Grier) works on a low-class tabloid news show featuring beautiful anchorwoman Kimberley Jonz (Robin Givens), whom he secretly loves. The Walkers live in Metro City, Illinois, a city that's been hit with a massive crime wave after the mayor is kidnapped by gangsters. After his grandmother is killed, Darryl builds a collection of crime-fighting robots from household junk, invents bullet-proof long underwear (made from his grandmother's old housecoat), and becomes Metro City's newest crime fighter, Blankman. Blankman's escapades put fear into the heart of mob boss Michael Minelli (Jon Polito), and when Kevin turns out to have an inside track on Blankman's activities, it brings him closer to Kimberley. But how long can a superhero with no superpowers last against the forces of organized crime? Damon Wayans wrote the original story for Blankman as well as co-writing the screenplay and playing the title role, which was based in part on his "Handi-Man" character from the TV comedy series In Living Color

programme.title: Ed
programme.desc: In this baseball comedy a potentially talented minor-league pitcher finds himself upstaged by the team's newest star player, a chimpanzee. The chimpanzee is actually played by two acrobats in a animatronic suit

programme.title: Inside Out
programme.desc: Emotions run wild in the mind of a young girl who is uprooted from her peaceful life in the Midwest and forced to move to San Francisco. Joy, Fear, Anger, Disgust and Sadness each have their own ideas about how she should handle her new surroundings

programme.title: Anywhere but Here
programme.desc: Comedy drama about the relationship between a daughter who wants a normal life, and her mother, whose desire for excitement leads her to dump her boring husband and seek adventure amid the bright lights of Beverly Hills

programme.title: Aloha
programme.desc: In this hilarious romantic comedy, a military-defense contractor is rehired by his former boss to oversee the launch of a satellite in Hawaii. He reconnects with an old flame while there, but finds himself increasingly drawn to an Air Force pilot assigned to watch over him

programme.title: American Violet
programme.desc: Nicole Beharie, Tim Blake Nelson, Will Patton, and Xzibit headline this fact-based drama about an innocent Texas mother caught up in a high-profile drug raid, and unjustly accused due to the uncorroborated testimony of a single informant. Dee Roberts (Beharie) is a young single mother of four living in a small Texas town. Arrested during a drug raid and accused of a crime she didn't commit, Dee goes against the wishes of her mother, Alma (Alfre Woodard), and rejects the plea-bargain that would free her from jail, but brand her as a felon for life. As word begins to spread that similar incidents are occurring in poor communities all across the country, Dee realizes that there are more mothers out there like her, and decides to take a stand against powerful district attorney Calvin Beckett (Michael O'Keefe). Now, despite being well aware of District Attorney Beckett's fierce reputation, Dee enlists the aid of ACLU attorney David Cohen (Nelson) and former narcotics officer Sam Conroy (Patton) in overcoming the seemingly insurmountable obstacles that, if not navigated with the greatest of caution, now threaten to destroy her life. With the custody of her children on the line, one brave mother wages a valiant battle to strike at the very heart of the corrupt Texas justice system(n)

programme.title: Just Another Day
programme.desc: A popular hip-hop star named A-Maze (Wood Harris) struggles with the pitfalls of success while up-and-coming rapper Young Eastie (Jamie Hector) attempts to avoid becoming a victim of his own fierce reputation in this intense drama(n)

programme.title: To Sir, With Love II
programme.desc: Sidney Poitier stars in this sequel to the 1967 classic. In this two-hour telefilm, Mark Thackeray is on the eve of his retirement from 30 years of teaching at a working class London School. During his retirement speech, he announces that he has accepted a teaching position on Chicago's south side. But Mark has another reason for wanting to go: he hopes to find his first love - a woman he met over thirty years ago when he was a young man in Guyana. Once in Chicago, Mark confronts immense challenges as he deals with his new and unruly students and comes face-to-face with his former lover

programme.title: The Little Vampire
programme.desc: Children's fantasy. A lonely nine-year-old boy gets picked on by his classmates when his family move from California to Scotland. He dreams of vampires, and one night he meets a vegetarian vampire boy about his own age and they become friends. The vampire's family hope to become human, but they need the missing part of a magic amulet. Evading a vampire hunter, the boys set out to obtain it

programme.desc: A family of mice decide to move out to the west, unaware that they are falling into a trap perpetrated by a smooth talking cat

programme.title: An American Tail 3: The Treasure of Manhattan Island
programme.desc: Everyone's favorite mouse adventurer returns in his most exciting quest yet. This action-packed made-for-video tale is filled with plenty of laughs, heart and new songs. Voices include Thomas Dekker, Dom DeLuise, Lacey Chabert and David Carradine

programme.title: Edward Scissorhands
programme.desc: Like most of Tim Burton's films, Edward Scissorhands doesn't offer much of a middle ground: You'll either adore it or ignore it. The film opens as eccentric inventor Vincent Price lovingly assembles a synthetic youth named Edward (Johnny Depp). The boy has all the essential ingredients except a pair of hands; he has temporarily been fitted out with pointy, shardlike metal extremities. Alas, the inventor dies before Edward can be completed. Left alone in the huge Price mansion, Edward is rescued by Avon lady Peg Boggs (Dianne Weist), who adopts the boy despite his scissorlike hands. Though his gestures have the capacity to maim or even kill, Edward is a gentle soul who wants only to be loved. Peg's daughter Kim (Winona Rider) likes Edward, but can't adjust to his clawlike hands and retreats to a tempestuous relationship with bully-boy Jim (Anthony Michael Hall). Becoming a local celebrity, Edward is surrounded by fair-weather friends. When he's accused of a crime, however, only Peg and Kim champion his cause. As bizarre as the proceeding becomes at times, Edward Scissorhands maintains its essential heart and warmth, thanks to a magnificent performance by Johnny Depp. Be prepared, however, for the most poignant finale this side of Chaplin's City Lights

programme.desc: One of the most popular characters on Sesame Street gets his own movie in this family comedy. programme.title: Olympics 2016
programme.desc: Men's rugby returns to the Games with a busy slate featuring the U.S. vs. Argentina. Zack Test, Perry Baker and Carlin Isles head the Americans, winners of the last two golds in 1920 and '24. Also: men's beach volleyball (Brazil vs. Canada)

programme.title: Olympics 2016
programme.desc: Spain vs. Brazil in men's basketball. Utah Jazz point guard Raul Neto helps spearhead the host nation against fellow NBA men Ricky Rubio (Timberwolves) and Jose Calderon (Lakers)

programme.title: Olympics 2016
programme.desc: Women's soccer contenders Germany and Canada square off in Brasília in their third and final group-stage match. Kadeisha Buchanan anchors the Canadian defense against Anja Mittag and Germany. Also: archery (men's and women's opening rounds)

programme.title: Olympics 2016
programme.desc: U.S. women's soccer faces Colombia to cap group-stage play in Manaus. Goalkeeper Hope Solo could make her 200th start for Team USA, which ended Colombia's run in last summer's World Cup with a 2-0 round-of-16 win

programme.title: Olympics 2016
programme.desc: Men's table-tennis quarterfinals are featured, plus finals in judo (women's 63kg and men's 81kg) and weightlifting (women's 63kg and men's 69kg). American Travis Stevens competes in judo

programme.title: Olympics 2016
programme.desc: Brazil takes the court for live men's volleyball against Canada in the second of three straight matches against North America for the host nation. Men's boxing features Charles Conwell, the only U.S. representative in the five heaviest men's divisions

programme.title: Olympics 2016
programme.desc: The women's cycling time trial covers a scenic 18.5-mile loop (29.8km) in western Rio, with Beijing and London winner Kristin Armstrong back in the start house at age 42. Others include fellow U.S. rider Evelyn Stevens and New Zealand's Linda Villumsen

programme.title: Olympics 2016
programme.desc: Three-time Tour de France winner Chris Froome looks to improve on his London bronze medal in the men's cycling time trial, covering 33.8 miles (54.5km) near Rio's Pontal beach area. Dutch rider Tom Dumoulin and France's Romain Bardet are others to watch off of top performances in "Le Tour."

programme.title: Olympics 2016
programme.desc: Men's soccer kicks off its final day of group-stage matches with Argentina vs. Honduras live in Brasília (Portugal meets Algeria in the other Group D contest). In fencing, 2015 Worlds silver-medalist Daryl Homer of the U.S. competes in sabre qualifying

programme.title: Olympics 2016
programme.desc: The U.S. women's basketball team is in action against Serbia, as Brittney Griner and Diana Taurasi face a Phoenix Mercury teammate in Serb forward Sonja Petrovic

programme.title: Olympics 2016
programme.desc: The U.S. takes on Japan in live women's field hockey, with Reinprecht sisters Julia and Katie among the nine Americans looking to erase the memory of a last-place finish at London 2012. Also: table tennis (women's semifinals)

programme.title: Olympics 2016
programme.desc: The U.S. faces Australia in men's basketball, with point guard Kyrie Irving and (since traded) Aussie shooter Matthew Dellavedova fresh off an NBA title with Cleveland. Australia has made nine of the last 10 Olympic quarterfinals, but has yet to medal

programme.title: Olympics 2016
programme.desc: The first quarterfinal bouts in men's boxing are featured (light flyweight and heavyweight), plus the debut of U.S. light welterweight Gary Antuanne Russell, youngest of four boxing brothers, all named Gary. Also: men's fencing (individual sabre finals)

programme.title: Olympics 2016
programme.desc: Brazilian men's soccer star Neymar leads the host nation in a group-stage finale vs. Denmark, from Fonte Nova Arena in Salvador. Emiliano Marcondes is of Brazilian descent for Denmark, a semifinalist at the 2015 European Under-21 championship(r)

programme.title: Olympics 2016
programme.desc: Rio's first table tennis medals are up for grabs in women's singles. China won gold in all seven previous Olympic finals, with no medalists coming from outside Asia(r)

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: From 2009: Orlando at Cleveland in Game 2 of the Eastern Conference finals. The Cavs won 96-95 on LeBron James' buzzer-beating trey. James dropped 32 points to tie up the series

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: From 2009: Los Angeles Lakers at Orlando in Game 5 of the Finals. Kobe Bryant and Pau Gasol lead the way as the Lakers capture their 15th NBA crown and coach Phil Jackson's tenth

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: From 2009: Boston at Chicago in Game 6 of a conference quarterfinal series. The Bulls and Celtics played their fifth, sixth and seventh overtime periods of the series, with Chicago prevailing 128-127 to send it back to Boston

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: From 2009: Houston at Los Angeles Lakers in Game 1 of a conference semifinal series. Yao Ming manned the middle for Houston against Kobe Bryant and L.A. in what turned out to be Yao's final NBA playoff series

programme.title: 2015-16 NBA Awards Show
programme.desc: A look at NBA award winners for MVP; Defensive Player; Rookie; Most Improved; Sixth Man; and Coach

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: From 2002: Los Angeles Lakers at New Jersey in Game 4 of the Finals. The Lakers finished off a sweep of Jersey with a 113-107 victory as Shaquille O'Neal scored 34 points and grabbed 10 rebounds. Kenyon Martin led all scorers with 35

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: Los Angeles Lakers at San Antonio in Game 5 of a 2004 Western Conference semifinal series. Derek Fisher's last-second field goal lifted L.A. to a 3-2 series lead. Tim Duncan had put the Spurs ahead with 1.8 seconds on the clock

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: From 2009: Los Angeles Lakers at Orlando in Game 4 of the Finals. Derek Fisher and Kobe Bryant lifted L.A. past the Magic 99-91 in overtime to take a 3-1 series lead. Dwight Howard had 16 points, 21 rebounds and nine blocks in defeat

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: From 2001: Sacramento at Los Angeles Lakers in Game 1 of the Western Conference semifinals. The Lakers won 108-106 behind Shaquille O'Neal's 44 points, 21 boards and seven blocks

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: From 2001: Los Angeles Lakers at Sacramento in Game 4 of a Western Conference semifinal series. L.A. won 119-113 to sweep the series as Kobe Bryant poured in 48 points and grabbed 16 rebounds, setting playoff career highs in both categories

programme.title: NBA Hardwood Classics
programme.desc: From 2001: Los Angeles Lakers at Philadelphia in Game 5 of the NBA Finals. The Lakers won 108-96 for their second straight title, and completed a 15-1 postseason

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: 9.79*. As directed by Daniel Gordon, this documentary revisits the explosive controversy that erupted at the height of the 24th Olympic Games, which took place in Seoul, South Korea from September through October 1988. Spectators of the original event will recall that two formidable athletes - American Carl Lewis and Canadian Ben Johnson - went head to head in the men's 100-meter dash; at the time, Lewis was still riding on the crest of his celebrity stature as a 1984 L.A. Olympics contender, and many regarded Johnson as the ultimate underdog, rebounding as he was from a pulled hamstring. Johnson won the hearts of Canadians everywhere and became a national hero by edging Lewis out during the event, in a spectacular time of 9.79 seconds. But within merely a few days, the Olympic committee shocked everyone by disqualifying Johnson on the basis of a failed drug y one test. In the immediate wake of this development, he lost his medal to Lewis. In this film, director Gordon opens up a mystery surrounding that changed decision: was Johnson, he asks, unique in using steroids, or merely the fall guy for a broad practice that involved multiple team members at the time, given the fact that six of Johnson's teammates were eventually indicted for the same reason? Gordon climbs inside of the controversy via interviews with Johnson, Lewis, teammates and Olympic insiders; in the process, he uncovers multiple layers of truth in this strange, disturbing situation that still invites discussion and inquiry, decades later

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Time's Arrow, Part II. When Next Generation kicked off its sixth season on September 26, 1992, it was with the resolution of the fifth-season cliffhanger "Time's Arrow." A quick recap apprises the viewer that, while investigating a curious archeological discovery, Lt. Cmdr. Data was sucked into a time vortex, emerging in 19th century San Francisco. Likewise heading into the past to rescue their comrade, the crew discovers that the Earth is in danger of a devastating alien invasion. Their efforts to ward off this disaster are complicated by the presence of a snoopy reporter by the name of Samuel Clemens (Jerry Hardin). Part two of "Time's Arrow" was scripted by Jeri Taylor, from a story by Joe Menosky and Michael Piller

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation

Hoping to confront his fear, he goes through with the transportation process, only to undergo an incredible experience which causes him to doubt his sanity. Written by Branson Braga, "Realm of Fear" originally aired October 3, 1992
